meanings.definition: To demagnetize (a magnetic tape, computer disk, etc.) by subjecting it to a magnetic field that reduces the magnetic flux to zero.
meanings.sent1: I need to degauss this old VHS tape before watching it.
meanings.sent2: The technician will degauss the hard drive to erase all data.
meanings.sent3: Trying to degauss a banana won't make it less magnetic!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to degauss the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The wizard used his wand to degauss the enchanted sword.

meanings.definition: To eliminate or reduce unwanted magnetism in (a ship, aircraft, etc.) by subjecting it to a strong alternating magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The engineers will degauss the submarine to avoid detection.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to degauss the aircraft to prevent interference.
meanings.sent3: I tried to degauss my shoes to stop sticking to the fridge!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to degauss the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The music had the power to degauss all negative thoughts from her mind.
